chapter.title: User Guide
chapter.para: The DocBook is about GPA and CGPA desktop software. This chapter is the User Guide for using Gpa and Cgpa calculator.

section.title: Install the GpaCgpa Program
section.para:
To measure the Grade Point Average or Cumulative Grade Point Average program, the end user need to download the program
A Computer program, or just a program, is a sequence of instructions, written to perform a specified task with a computer.
from the web link. The process to download the program is simple and the user requires few knowledge how to use the website using the web browser. It is recommended to follow the procedure given:
Computer program
Step 1: Open any web browser of your choice (Firefox, Chrome, Safari, Internet Explorer) Step 2: Go to the address bar and type "http://sourceforge.net/projects/cgpagpa/" Step 3: Click on the Download Button Step 4: Soon after downloading the CgpaGpa.zip, extract the file

Check that you have Java Virtual Machine(JVM) installed on your computer:
Open the Command Prompt (CMD)
Type 'java -jar GpaCgpa.jar'
The program will launch soon after providing the above command in CMD

note.para: Start Menu > Programs > Accessories > Command Prompt

important.para:
If there is no JVM installed in the computer, please visit the website to know more about how to install the necessary Java Virtual Machine and other programs:
Know about JVM: http://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jvms/se7/html/
Download the JVM and install the software in your machine: https://java.com/en/download/index.jsp
Open the Command Prompt from the Start Menu; see the notification below..
Start typing the command java -jar GpaCgpa.jar at the command prompt
The Gpa and Cgpa Calculator will launch soon after providing the above command in CMD successfully
Java version and command to run the program
Start Menu > All Programs > Accessories > Command Prompt
java -jar GpaCgpa.jar

section.title: Description
section.para:
Grade Point Average(GPA) is the calculation which is used at the end of a semester
A semester is an academic term. A semester system divides the academic year into two terms, which are usually 14â€“20 weeks each.
. The GPA is the key to calculate the student performance which is evaluated by the teacher or authorized person. There are two input areas where the end-user or the student requires to enter the data:
GPA
Semester
Credit Hours
A course credit (often credit hour, or just credit or unit) is a unit that gives weighting to the value, level or time requirements of an academic course taken at a school or other educational institution
Grade Achieved
Credit Hours

simplelist.member: Step 1: Enter the data in the Credit Hours and the Grade Achieved
Step 2: Click the CALCULATE GPA button to calculate and to view the GPA, total credits, and performance status [Figure 2.5].
Step 3: Click the Reset Data button to empty the Credit Hours and the Grade Achieved to clear the data
Step 4: Click the Back to main button to return to the main interface [Figure 2.3]

warning.para: Do not leave the Credit Hours and the Grade Achieved empty; Please enter ZERO (0) in the Credit Hours and enter small or capital alphabet X in the Grade Achieved box.

figure.title: Grade Point Average calculation with sample input

section.title: Description
section.para:
The Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) is the overall GPA of the entire academic year
Academic year - the period of time each year when the school is open and people are studying, http://www.thefreedictionary.com/academic+year
at the university. The CGPA is considered as the final performance report for a student. There are four input areas where the end-user or the student requires to enter the data:
Academic year
Previous total credits completed
Previous CGPA, not GPA
Total credits taken in this semester
GPA achieved (Current Semester)

Step 4: Click the Back to main button to return to the main interface [Figure 2.3]
